Package com.ee364project.Fx

Class MainSceneController

java.lang.Object
com.ee364project.Fx.MainSceneController
public class MainSceneController extends Object
The MainSceneController class manages the GUI of the application. It holds references to agents, customers, problems, and departments, as well as handles recent files, thread synchronization, and thread execution. agents: an array of Agent objects. customers: an array of Customer objects. problems: an array of objects implementing the HasData interface representing problems. departments: an array of objects implementing the HasData interface representing departments. recentFiles: a list of recently accessed files. RECENT_FILES_FILE: the file name to store recent files information. MAX_RECENT_FILES: the maximum number of recent files to keep track of. phaser: a Phaser for synchronization. pausePlay: a thread used for pausing and playing the simulation. endThread: a flag indicating the end of the simulation thread. executor: a ThreadPoolExecutor for managing threads. customerImage: the image for representing customers. agentImage: the image for representing agents. callImage: the image for representing calls. callCenter: the reference to the CallCenter. timerTimeline: the timeline for handling timer events. callCount: counts call number to display in GUI ActiveText: a Text component displaying information about active elements. AgentVbox: a VBox for organizing Agent-related components. MenBar: the main menu bar. saveAsbtn: a MenuItem for the "Save As" option. MenNew: a MenuItem for the "New" option. MenPasue: a MenuItem for the "Pause" option. MenPlay: a MenuItem for the "Play" option. MenStart: a MenuItem for the "Start" option. MenuOld: a MenuItem for the "Old" option. OpenRecentMenu: a Menu for displaying recent files. anchorPane: an AnchorPane for organizing components. flowPane: a FlowPane for organizing components. timeer: a Text component displaying information about the timer. checkPoint: a CheckBox component. phase2MenItem: a CheckMenuItem for the "Phase 2" option. Vox: a VBox for organizing components. CallVbox: a VBox for organizing components related to calls. connected: a Button component.

  • Constructor Details

    • MainSceneController

      public MainSceneController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the main scene components and sets up event handlers. It sets references and configurations for various UI elements, such as buttons, panes, and timelines. Additionally, it configures the checkbox to add or remove a time property listener based on its state.

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pauses the simulation, disabling the pause button and enabling the play button. The timeline controlling the timer is paused, and a separate thread is started to wait for the play button to be clicked. Once the play button is clicked, the simulation resumes, re-enabling the pause button and disabling the play button. This is done by deresitering the thread from the phaser and ending the loop

    • showYesNoDialog

      public void showYesNoDialog(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Displays a confirmation dialog for selecting the simulation type: old customers or new customers. This method creates a JavaFX Alert with custom buttons for the two simulation types and waits for the user's response. Depending on the chosen option, the corresponding callback method is invoked.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - the primary stage used as the owner of the dialog.

    • handleOpenFile

      public void handleOpenFile(File zipFile)
      Handles the opening of a zip file selected by the user. The method processes the zip file by extracting its components into a directory named "extracted." It then processes the CSV files extracted from the zip file and deletes the extracted files and directory after processing. The method also updates the recent files list, the recent files menu, and saves the recent files.
      Parameters:
      zipFile - the zip file selected by the user to be opened and processed.

    • processProblemFile

      public void processProblemFile(File problemFile)
      Processes a CSV file containing problem data. Reads the CSV file using the Csv.read(String, String) method, creates an array of Problem objects from the read data, and handles any exceptions that may occur during the process.
      Parameters:
      problemFile - The CSV file containing problem data to be processed.

    • processDepartmentFile

      public void processDepartmentFile(File departmentFile)
      Processes a CSV file containing department data. Reads the CSV file using the Csv.read(String, String) method, creates an array of Department objects from the read data, and handles any exceptions that may occur during the process.
      Parameters:
      departmentFile - The CSV file containing department data to be processed.

    • highlightMax

      public void highlightMax()
      Highlights the row of the customer with the maximum wait time in the customer table. This method identifies the customer with the maximum wait time, finds its corresponding row index in the customer table, and highlights that row. If the identified row index is the same as the last highlighted index, the method does nothing to avoid unnecessary refreshes. The method utilizes the resetHighlightRows and highlightRow methods to handle the highlighting logic.

    • highlightCustomers

      public void highlightCustomers()
      Highlights the visual representation of customers in the UI based on their current state. This method iterates through the array of customers, retrieves their visual representation from the UI, and applies specific highlights based on their current state. The highlights are applied by adjusting the properties of the ImageView associated with each customer. Different states result in different highlight colors (green for INCALL, yellow for WAITING, blue for CHECK_FAQS), while the default state removes any applied effects.

    • showErrorAlert

      public static void showErrorAlert(String title, String content)
      Displays an error alert with the specified title and content. This method creates and shows an error alert using the JavaFX Alert class with the ERROR alert type. The alert includes a title, optional header text (null in this case), and content text that describes the error or provides additional information. The alert is displayed modally, and the execution is paused until the user closes the alert using the "OK" button.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the error alert.
      content - The content text of the error alert describing the error or providing information.

    • connectingCall

      public void connectingCall(Call call)
      Initiates the process of connecting a call by displaying a "Connecting..." label, activating the call, and connecting it to the call center. This method is responsible for updating the UI to indicate that the call is in the process of connecting. It adds a "Connecting..." label to the call's HBox, and after a brief delay, removes the label and proceeds to activate the call and connect it to the call center.
      Parameters:
      call - The Call object representing the call to be connected.

    • activateCall

      public void activateCall(javafx.scene.layout.HBox hBox, Agent agent, Call call)
      Activates a call by updating the UI with relevant information such as call icon, agent details, and call number. This method is responsible for enhancing the visual representation of an active call in the UI. It adds components like the call icon, agent image, checkbox, and call number to the specified HBox. Additionally, it associates a tooltip with the agent's details for informational purposes.
      Parameters:
      hBox - The HBox in the UI where the call components will be added.
      agent - The Agent associated with the call.
      call - The Call object representing the active call.

    • createHbox

      public javafx.scene.Node[] createHbox(Customer customer)
      Creates and returns an array of JavaFX nodes representing a graphical representation of a customer's call in the user interface.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer associated with the call.
      Returns:
      An array of JavaFX nodes representing the graphical representation of the call.

    • handleCheckboxAction

      public void handleCheckboxAction(String callNumber, javafx.scene.control.CheckBox checkbox)
      Handles the action triggered by checking or unchecking a checkbox associated with a call. This method is responsible for managing the behavior when a call's checkbox is checked or unchecked. If a checkbox is checked, it creates or shows the associated dialog window for the call. If unchecked, it closes or exits the associated dialog window.
      Parameters:
      callNumber - The identifier of the call associated with the checkbox.
      checkbox - The checkbox representing the call.

    • checkPoint

      public void checkPoint()
      Checks the simulation progress and prompts the user for a decision at regular intervals. This method is called periodically to assess the simulation progress. If the current time is a multiple of 50, the simulation is paused, and a custom confirmation dialog is presented to the user. The user can choose to end the simulation and view the results or continue with the simulation. The results include total call count, total wait time, and average wait time for all customers.
